name: Adabco Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at Adabco Boutique Hotel for 5 nights last week. It was calm, clean, pleasant and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, giving advice about transport, parking, local restaurants and trips to the Barossa. Staff at the desk described it as the maiden aunt end of the CBD which was a reference to the quietness of the area and the ease of parking at the front of the hotel, despite being in a main street. There is no off-street parking which I thought would be a problem but I was able to park in front of the hotel every night and it was perfectly safe. The breakfast which was included in the tariff was ordinary - 3 cereals, tinned fruit, 3 different breads, spreads, tea, coffee and fruit juice - but I normally have coffee and toast so there was no problem. There is a kitchen on each of the 3 floors so it is possible to cook your own meals if you want a full breakfast or to eat in at night. I would defintely stay here again. (The paintings on the wall were very boring, unlike the rest of the hotel)
reviews.title: What a pleasant place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 nights in August, and found Adabco to be perfect for our needs. It is very centrally located so we could walk to anywhere within the four terraces very easily, and it's also an easy walk to the zoo to see the pandas. I loved that it had a guest kitchen, as after all those wine tours during the day (with big lunches) we didn't always want a full dinner out every evening, so it was nice to be able to make some cheese on toast or kangaroo sausages/emu burgers some nights, but without having to book a more expensive hotel with private kitchen that wasn't needed every night. The breakfast was great - even though it was continental, I was pleased that they had 3 choices of bread for toast and two types of cereal (including a very delicious muesli) with fruit. There is a computer that you can use to check your email/Facebook etc, and I never had to wait for more than about 10 minutes to use it, so that was also appreciated. I'll most definitely stay there if I go back to Adelaide.
reviews.title: Really great hotel, highly recommended

Nice Place to stay in Adelaide
reviews.text: Excellent stay at Adabco Boutique Hotel. Clean rooms with nice Continental Breakfast and well appointed communal kitchens on each floor.

This hotel was a beautiful historic building and had a tasteful modern interior that allowed for an ease of living(self service kitchen and surrounded by great restaurants) whilst working in Adelaide. The staff made the stay really enjoyable with their eagerness to help with any needs.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Adelaide

description: Adabco Boutique Hotel (formerly Wakefield Residence) is set in one of Adelaide's significant and beautiful heritage buildings. It has 70 elegantly appointed rooms with modern furnishing, appliances and finishes. The spacious rooms are all equipped with a flat screen LCD TV, Foxtel, high speed broadband access and a large executive desk for the corporate traveller. Situated in the heart of the city, the hotel is within walking distance to the restaurant precincts of Hutt Street, North Terrace, the Convention Centre, Hindley Street, Chinatown, the Central Market, and the Rundle Mall shopping precinct. Adabco Boutique hotel is an independent hotel suited to the discerning traveller that requires a retreat from the pressures of travel and access to some of the city's major and most memorable attractions.
